title: Meet and Eat
description: Time to kick off camp! Join us for some snacks and getting to know your fellow campers!
comment: I’ll be there and am very much looking forward to meeting everyone.

title: Shop Safety!
description: Get Shop certified!

title: Introduction to Max/MSP/Jitter
description: Max/MSP/Jitter is a multimedia authoring environment that enables you to create programs for real-time manipulation of media (data, audio, video, 3d). It is used in performance and installations by artists, composers, and people just like you!

title: exploring biomimicry
description: This 2-hour workshop on biomimicry will address nature as inspiration for design and technological solutions. We will consider the biological and natural world, and work hands on to create quick prototypes using paper, pen, and some building materials, on topics that might include re-designing social networks, mapping urban spaces, and re-defining user interfaces.

title: Product Design/DigiFab
description: We will be covering design tools (software and hardware) for digital fabrication.

title: ITP Mappathon: Content Making for Projection Mapping
description:
Step 1
 This week, we will learn how to make visual content using Modul8.
 We will use a png, a jpg and a movie files to make a moving image using Modul8. This method is a great tool to camp your idea.

title: the beauty of ephemeral life
description: A talk about my work in recent and past.

title: Introduction to Soft Circuits
description: In this class, we will go over conductive materials used in creating soft circuits, such as different thread, fabrics, inks and fasteners, along with looking at microcontrollers designed specifically for wearable electronics. Projects that have been created utilizing these techniques will also be shown. We will then create a simple soft circuit with a switch and that lights up a LED. Attendees will have the chance to learn or expand on basic hand sewing techniques and experience working with new materials and skills.

title: Quantified Self: Tools, Trends, and Applications
description: When Forbes called 2013 “the year of the Quantified Self” at CES it became clear that this is no longer a niche field just for life loggers. In this session I will go through the history of the quantified self (QS) movement, the existing apps/devices available, ways to hack together your own tools, trends in the industry, and discuss areas that are still untouched by this phenomenon that seems to be the new buzz word of 2013. A year and a half ago my life changed when I began tracking what I ate and how I felt, eventually leading me to cut gluten and dairy out of my diet. Since then I have become immersed in the QS field, helping to co-organize numerous Quantified Self Meetups here in NY, experimenting with dozens of QS tools/apps, and hacking together numerous quantified self tools of my own and in groups with others. By the end of this session participants should have a thorough understanding of the existing QS landscape, be aware of industries ripe for QS development, and be primed with some easy ways to hack together their own projects and tools.

title: Intro to After Effects
description: I’ll be attending.

title: Intro to Makerbotting
description: Learn how to go from file to print. In this lightning session, you will learn how to calibrate a MakerBot, prepare a 3D file (STL) using MakerWare, and then print it on the machines. That’s all there is to it!

title: Smart Dust – is it inevitable?
description: I’d argue that the era of the commodity beige box is coming to an end, and the days of the general purpose computer are almost over. Most people never needed or wanted a computer, and they’re going to be happy with more limited devices optimised for a single, or a few, purposes so long as those devices just work. Today the black rectangle has replaced the beige box, but don’t get too comfortable, because it won’t last as long. Today’s cellphones and tablets are transition devices, dependent on our current level of technological progress, and around you everyday objects are already becoming smarter.
comment: I an make it after all!

title: Sensing our surroundings : log sensor data using arduino
description: This hands on workshop will address visualizing data input from Arduino. The context of the class will be based around open source semi-autonomous sailing robots called Protei, designed to sense & clean oceans. After a brief introduction about Protei project, the remainder of the session will be devoted to understanding the very basics of sensing & exploring the environment through collecting & visualizing data using remote sensors, including sensors such as photocells, potentiometers, and more complex ones like barometers, GPS, and accelerometers.

title: Film Cutting, Knot Tying, and The Ethics of Storytelling
description: In this participatory lecture, we will discuss the ethics behind story telling in interactive/immersive documentary, while cutting film and learning how to tie knots.

title: CNC Fun Day
description:
Stacks on stacks of CNC education! You don’t really need anything to attend this session, just a good attitude!
 It’s gonna be rad!

title: Rest Of You: Digital Edition
description: Life is what happens to you will you are busy doing other things.  You pay attention to a small part of your experience when it is the rest of you that is more important.  The Rest of You is a class about trying to get a better picture of those parts that you don’t pay attention to.  This session will zero in on one week of work in the Rest Of You class that tries to cull through your digital footprint to give you a more accurate picture of yourself and perhaps suggest some interventions to change the rest of you.    Here are some assignments from the digital week of this class http://itp.nyu.edu/~dbo3/roy/?cat=12

title: Guest Speaker: Clive Thompson – “the new literacies”
Wearable and Mobile Accessories
description: Kate Hartman and Shawn Van Every will give a tour through some of the recent wireless and wearable platforms and products that are emerging and give a workshop on how we might prototype some ideas of our own.

title: Faster Fashion – Rapid Prototyping and the Things We Wear
Face It
description: In this short workshop, we will examine the human face. We’ll look at the differences between face detection and face recognition as well as demonstrate examples that track the contours of the face. In addition, we’ll look at some image processing techniques for face morphing. Examples will be demonstrated in Processing.

title: Guest Speaker: Andrew Dent from Material ConneXion
description: Andrew Dent will be joining us to discuss what’s happening with materials and what’s soon to come.

title: Creating a Killer Finish
description: We have two great tools in the shop for applying a fantastic finish to wooden and metal projects.

title: Designing Interactive Experiences for Public Spaces
Visual Effects and Compositing using After Effects
description: In this workshop we’ll look at using After Effects for visual effects and compositing, including green screen and motion tracking.

title: Designing Projections for a Chamber Opera
description: I recently created video projections for “Lotus Lives,” a new independent one-hour opera written for two singers, a brass quintet, percussion, and audio-video playback. I tackled everything from content design and creation, through coordinating six projectors with a live performance on a limited budget, and making sure it ran smoothly.

title: End-of-Camp Shindig
description: Half show & tell, half party, the End of Camp Shindig is an opportunity to celebrate the month we’ve spent together and share what we’ve created.
